name: THE GAME OF LIFE: Road Trip
Isle of Arrows â Tower Defense

editorialNotes.standard: Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and soundâand a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, itâs surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.
Scurry to victory with mountains of cheese by stealing from friends and evading the mousetrap in this lively digital re-imagining of the popular board game.

editorialNotes.standard: Whatâs made OLO game one of our longtime multiplayer favourites? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for pointsâand slyly knocking an opponentâs discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennepâs all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.
